data.title: Microsoft to offer some free security products after criticism
data.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 19 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp (MSFT.O) is expanding its suite of free security tools for customers, the software company said on Wednesday, following criticism that it was charging clients to protect themselves against Microsoft's mistakes. data.title: Microsoft puts a price tag on its AI "copilots" for business
data.snippet: Microsoft announced Tuesday it will charge $30 per user per month for businesses that want to use its AI-infused copilots to automate work in Office products such as Word, PowerPoint and Excel. data.title: Microsoft faces antitrust scrutiny from the European Union over Teams, Office 365
data.snippet: Reportedly, the EC and Microsoft are at odds over whether the pricing of Teams limits opportunities for fair competition from similar video conferencing apps such as Slack and Zoom. Slack filed a complaint with the EU in 2020, claiming that Microsoft was "force installing [Teams] for millions, blocking its removal, and hiding the true cost to enter..
